entry.title: George Roper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on its maiden voyage from Liverpool to Australia, the George Roper ran aground (pictured) and was wrecked?

entry.title: Dora Goldstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dora Goldstein exposed mice to alcoholic vapor to investigate the biochemistry of alcohol addiction and alcohol withdrawal syndrome?

entry.title: intangible heritage unique to Palestine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that intangible heritage unique to Palestine includes women's story-telling, embroidery, dance, and soap-making?

entry.title: Nia Archives (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before becoming a jungle musician, Nia Archives wanted to be an archaeologist?

entry.title: 2023 AFL Women's Grand Final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Brisbane Lions player said the sight of a jerrycan motivated her team during the 2023 AFL Women's Grand Final?

entry.title: Sun Haiyan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sun Haiyan is the first Chinese ambassador to Singapore who was not a member of the Foreign Ministry of China?

entry.title: I'm God (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it took eleven years for the instrumental track "I'm God" to receive an official release?

entry.title: Joseph S. Bartley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Joseph S. Bartley was sentenced to twenty years in prison for embezzlement, he tried to have himself declared legally dead?
